menu

Ajax Layout

Tip! The ajax starter page is a good place to start building your app if you'd like to start from scratch.

Default ajax layout used for all pages (except for login) is the same as the default html layout with some additional elements, script and attributes

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, shrink-to-fit=no">
  <meta name="msapplication-tap-highlight" content="no"/>
  <!-- Font & Icon -->
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../font/inter/inter.min.css">
  <link href="../../plugins/material-design-icons-iconfont/material-design-icons.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
  <link href="../../plugins/fontawesome-free/css/all.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
  <!-- Plugins -->
  <!-- CSS plugins goes here -->
  <!-- Main Style -->
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../plugins/perfect-scrollbar/perfect-scrollbar.min.css">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/style.css" id="main-css">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/sidebar-gray.min.css" id="theme-css"> <!-- options: blue,cyan,dark,gray,green,pink,purple,red,royal,ash,crimson,namn,frost -->
  <title>Your Brand</title>
</head>

<body>  <!-- use <body class="sidebar-collapse"> to have a collapsed sidebar -->

  <!-- Ajax loader -->
  <div id="ajaxloader" class="fade"></div>

  <!-- Sidebar -->
  <div class="sidebar">

    <!-- Sidebar header -->
    <div class="sidebar-header">
      <!-- sidebar header... goes here -->
    </div>
    <!-- /Sidebar header -->

    <!-- Sidebar body -->
    <div class="sidebar-body">
      <!-- sidebar body... goes here -->
    </div>
    <!-- /Sidebar body -->

  </div>
  <!-- /Sidebar -->

  <!-- Main -->
  <div class="main">

    <!-- Main header -->
    <div class="main-header">
      <!-- main header... goes here -->
    </div>
    <!-- /Main header -->

    <!-- Main body -->
    <div class="main-body">

      AJAX CONTENT GOES HERE

    </div>
    <!-- /Main body -->

  </div>
  <!-- /Main -->

  <!-- Main Scripts -->
  <script src="../js/jquery.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../../plugins/bs-custom-file-input/bs-custom-file-input.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../../plugins/perfect-scrollbar/perfect-scrollbar.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../../plugins/feather-icons/feather.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../js/script.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../js/settings.min.js"></script>
  <script src="../js/ajax.js" id="ajax-js"></script>

  <!-- Plugins -->
  <!-- JS plugins goes here -->
  <script>
    App.ajax({
      'container': '.main-body',
      'default': 'starter-content.html',
      'breadcrumb': true
    })
  </script>

</body>

</html>

Ajax Content

* Again as a reminder, you should use the ajax starter page so that you understand correctly

Here is a simple example of ajax content:

<p>Hi, this content is loaded via ajax</p>

<script>
App.loadPlugins(null, null).then(() => {
  // your script here
}).then(() => App.stopLoading())
</script>

Loading JS & CSS Files

To add new styles to a page, you can simply insert "style" tags:

<style>
  .welcome {
    font-weight: bold;
    color: blue;
  }
</style>
<p class="welcome">Hi, this content is loaded via ajax</p>

<script>
  App.loadPlugins(null, null).then(() => {
    // your script here
  }).then(() => App.stopLoading())
</script>

To load new css and js files, you should do it in the following way:

<p>Hi, this content is loaded via ajax</p>

<script>
var plugins = [
  'path/to/your/plugin.css',
  'path/to/your/another_plugin.css',
  'path/to/your/plugin.js',
  'path/to/your/another_plugin.js',
]
var script = [
  'path/to/your/script.js'
]
App.loadPlugins(plugins, script).then(() => {
  // your script here
}).then(() => App.stopLoading())
</script>
Please note that, scripts loaded from "plugins" variable will be loaded and executed only once.
But sometimes, some scripts are related to a page and should be run everytime the page is loaded.
In that case you can put the script to "script" variable

Loading JS & CSS Files Synchronously

loadPlugins use javascript Promise which perform request asynchronously.
For some cases you need to load other plugins in sequence, you can add true to third parameter
this will make Promise work called "Async/await" which means perform request synchronously 
<p>Hi, this content is loaded via ajax</p>

<script>
var plugins = [
  'path/to/your/plugin.css',
  'path/to/your/another_plugin.css',
  'path/to/your/plugin.js',
  'path/to/your/plugin2_that_required_plugin1.js',
]
var script = [
  'path/to/your/script.js'
]
App.loadPlugins(plugins, script, true).then(() => { // add 'true' to third parameter to perform request synchronously
  // your script here
}).then(() => App.stopLoading())
</script>
